page.title: 16FARMING IN NACTON
page.content: The estate owns 2,300 acres but only 1,255 acres are arable. Four hundred acres are mixed, deciduous, natural woodland. A little land is contracted out for sheep grazing. There are 40 deer on which are not culled. One man is in charge of the arable section of the estate. The soil is light and sandy and soil erosion has been controlled by high hedges and trees acting as wind breaks. Barley,wheat, duram wheat,rye and triticale are grown. There are only four workers on the farm who work long hours six days a week. On Sunday one man will check the irrigators morning and night. At harvest time, the men usually work from 7.00 a.m. to 5.00p.m. The estate has one main tractor of one hundred horse-power and four smaller tractors. It is a very highly mechanised farm.
